meanings.sent1: I will start uncrating the new furniture for the living room.
meanings.sent2: The workers were uncrating the fragile items with caution.
meanings.sent3: The magician's assistant uncrated a rabbit instead of a dove during the show.
meanings.sent4: She uncrated her emotions, revealing her true feelings to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunter uncrating the ancient chest discovered a hidden compartment.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something out of a crate.
meanings.sent1: The uncrating of the new equipment took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The uncrating process was smooth and efficient at the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The uncrating of the giant teddy bear brought smiles to the children's faces.
meanings.sent4: The uncrating of memories from the past made her nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The uncrating of the mysterious package revealed a surprise gift inside.
